vocabularies.englishDefinition: feel fear
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: When someone is afraid, they feel fear.
vocabularies.example: The woman was afraid of what she saw.

vocabularies.englishDefinition: to say "yes" or to think the same way
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: To agree is to say “yes” or to think the same way
vocabularies.example:
A: The food is very good in that restaurant.
B: I agree with you.

vocabularies.englishDefinition: want to speak loudly or fight
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: When someone is angry, they may want to speak loudly or fight
vocabularies.example: She didn’t do her homework, so her father is angry

vocabularies.englishDefinition: to get to or reach some place
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: To arrive is to get to or reach some place
vocabularies.example: The bus always arrives at the corner of my street at 4:00

vocabularies.englishDefinition: to try to fight or to hurt
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: To attack is to try to fight or to hurt
vocabularies.example: The man with the sword attacked the other man first

vocabularies.englishDefinition: the lowest part
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: The bottom is the lowest part
vocabularies.example: The bottom of my shoe has a hole in it

vocabularies.englishDefinition: can solve a hard puzzle or problem
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: When someone is clever, they can solve a hard puzzle or problem
vocabularies.example: The clever boy thought of a good idea

vocabularies.englishDefinition: do bad things to hurt others
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: When someone is cruel, they do bad things to hurt others
vocabularies.example: The cruel man yelled at his sister

vocabularies.englishDefinition: happens after a longtime or at the end
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: If something happens finally, it happens after a longtime or at the end
vocabularies.example: He finally crossed the finish line after five hours of running

vocabularies.englishDefinition: to try not to let others see you
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: To hide is to try not to let others see you
vocabularies.example: The other children will hide while you count to 100

vocabularies.englishDefinition: to look for or search for an animal to kill
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: To hunt is to look for or search for an animal to kill
vocabularies.example: Long ago, people hunted with bows and arrows

vocabularies.englishDefinition: a large number or amount of people, animals, things, etc
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: A lot means a large number or amount of people, animals, things, etc
vocabularies.example: There are a lot of apples in the basket

vocabularies.englishDefinition: center or halfway point
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: The middle of something is the center or halfway point
vocabularies.example: The Canadian flag has a maple leaf in the middle of it

vocabularies.englishDefinition: a second or a very short time
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: A moment is a second or a very short time
vocabularies.example: I was only a few moments late for the meeting.

vocabularies.englishDefinition: happy or satisfied
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: When someone is pleased, they are happy
vocabularies.example: She was pleased with the phone call she received

vocabularies.englishDefinition: to say you will do something for sure
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: To promise is to say you will do something for sure
vocabularies.example: He promised to return my key by tomorrow

vocabularies.englishDefinition: to give an answer or say back to someone
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: To reply is to give an answer or say back to someone
vocabularies.example: She asked him what time his meeting was. He replied, "at three".

vocabularies.englishDefinition: not in danger
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: When a person is safe, they are not in danger
vocabularies.example: Put on your seat belt in the car to be safe

vocabularies.englishDefinition: to fool another person
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: A trick is something you do to fool another person
vocabularies.example: His card trick really surprised us.

vocabularies.englishDefinition: something was done in a good way
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: You use well to say that something was done in a good way
vocabularies.example: The couple can dance quite well

vocabularies.englishDefinition: fun or exciting thing that you do
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: An adventure is a fun or exciting thing that you do
vocabularies.example: Riding in the rough water was an adventure

vocabularies.englishDefinition: to move close to it
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: To approach something means to move close to it
vocabularies.example: The boy approached his school

vocabularies.englishDefinition: great attention, especially to detail or safety
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: Carefully means with great attention, especially to detail or safety
vocabularies.example: The baby carefully climbed down the stairs

vocabularies.englishDefinition: something that scientists use in chemistry
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: A chemical is something that scientists use in chemistry
vocabularies.example: The scientist mixed the chemicals

vocabularies.englishDefinition: to make something new
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: To create means to make something new
vocabularies.example: She created an igloo from blocks of snow

vocabularies.englishDefinition: something or someone bad or cruel, not good
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: Evil describes something or someone bad or cruel, not good
vocabularies.example: The evil figure scared us all

vocabularies.englishDefinition: a test that you do to see what will happen
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: An experiment is a test that you do to see what will happen
vocabularies.example: The student did an experiment in science class

vocabularies.englishDefinition: to make them die
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: To kill someone or something is to make them die
vocabularies.example: I killed the fly with a fly swatter

vocabularies.englishDefinition: a room where a scientist works
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: A laboratory is a room where a scientist works
vocabularies.example: My mother works in a laboratory

vocabularies.englishDefinition: the sound made when someone is happy or a funny thing occurs
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: Laugh is the sound made when someone is happy or a funny thing occurs
vocabularies.example: The sound of their laugh filled the room

vocabularies.englishDefinition: it is strong and very easy to hear
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: If a sound is loud, it is strong and very easy to hear
vocabularies.example: The man’s voice was so loud that we all could hear him

vocabularies.englishDefinition: they think something bad will happen, worried and anxious
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: When a person is nervous, they think something bad will happen
vocabularies.example: The boy became nervous when he heard the news

vocabularies.englishDefinition: an unpleasant sound
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: A noise is an unpleasant sound
vocabularies.example: The crying baby made a loud noise

vocabularies.englishDefinition: a type of work that you do for school ora job
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: A project is a type of work that you do for school or a job
vocabularies.example: His afternoon work project was to paint the room green

vocabularies.englishDefinition: to make them feel afraid
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: To scare someone is to make them feel afraid
vocabularies.example: My uncle was scared by what he saw in the room

vocabularies.englishDefinition: something that you do not tell other people
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: A secret is something that you do not tell other people
vocabularies.example: The two boys were sharing a secret

vocabularies.englishDefinition: to say something loudly
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: To shout is to say something loudly
vocabularies.example: My boss shouted at me because I was late for work

vocabularies.englishDefinition: use your nose to sense it
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: To smell something means to use your nose to sense it
vocabularies.example: The two friends smelled the flower

vocabularies.englishDefinition: it is very bad
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: If something is terrible, it is very bad
vocabularies.example: The way he treated his classmate was terrible

vocabularies.englishDefinition: it is of poorer quality than another thing
vocabularies.englishDefinitionSentence: If something is worse, it is of poorer quality than another thing
vocabularies.example: Business was worse this month than last month
